At the beginning of the second period
At the beginning of the extra time

answers: Team A continues to play with fewer than 5 players

question_template: %s team A can continue the game with only 4 players because of %s. Coach B, demonstrating fair play, wants to remove one of his players in order to play 4vs4.
template_substitutions: Near the end of the game
Near the end of the third period
answers: The request of coach B is denied as team B must play with 5 players
Team B must still play with 5 players
Team B can play with four players if they want
Team A loses the game by forfeit
explanation: I9-4 The request of coach B to play with less than 5 players shall be denied. As long as a team has sufficient players available, 5 players shall be on the playing court.

question_template: %s, both teams are confused and attack/defend the wrong basket. The situation is discovered after a foul is committed on A4 in the act of shooting.
template_substitutions: At the beginning of the second half
At the beginning of the second period
answers: The game is resumed with free throws for A4, but on the right basket
The foul is ignored and team A gets a throw-in from the free-throw line extended
Shooting towards the own basket is not considered act of shooting, therefore team A gets a throw-in
explanation: I9-5 If by confusion any period begins with both teams attacking/defending the wrong baskets, the situation shall be corrected as soon as it is discovered, without placing either team at a disadvantage. Any points scored, time used, fouls charged, etc. before the stopping of the game remain valid.
